article_text:
Your editorial opposing the U.S. Department of Labor’s guidelines for easing Erisa restrictions for states enacting government-initiated retirement plans for workers in the private sector without an employer-sponsored plan misrepresents the intent of the proposal (“ Obama’s New Public Pension Option,” Review & Outlook, Nov 27).

Contrary to your contention, the states would not guarantee the plans; taxpayers would not be on the...

twitter.description: The states would not guarantee the plans; taxpayers would not be on the hook.
twitter.title: Public-Private Sector Retirement Solutions

article_summary:
Contrary to your contention, the states would not guarantee the plans; taxpayers would not be on the...
Your editorial opposing the U.S. Department of Labor’s guidelines for easing Erisa restrictions for states enacting government-initiated retirement plans for workers in the private sector without an employer-sponsored plan misrepresents the intent of the proposal (“ Obama’s New Public Pension Option,” Review & Outlook, Nov 27).
